sgcool_label_text:This textile is probably a tray or pillow cover. An elaborately embroidered red and blue border
 made up of multiple bands of floral and abstract designs
 surrounds a hexagonal field. One recurring motif is a vase of flowers in full bloom. Peacocks perch on its branches
 their feathers spread like a fan. This was produced using the technique known as drawn thread embroidery
 whiich involves the extraction of warp and weft threads from a piece of cloth stretched upon a wooden frame. Not only does drawn thread embroidery demand expertise
 it is also extremely labour intensive. Penang was especially known for the use of this technique in the early 20th century.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This textile is probably a tray or pillow cover. An elaborately embroidered red and blue border, made up of multiple bands of floral and abstract designs, surrounds a hexagonal field. One recurring motif is a vase of flowers in full bloom. Peacocks perch on its branches, their feathers spread like a fan. This was produced using the technique known as drawn thread embroidery, whiich involves the extraction of warp and weft threads from a piece of cloth stretched upon a wooden frame. Not only does drawn thread embroidery demand expertise, it is also extremely labour intensive. Penang was especially known for the use of this technique in the early 20th century.
